item.title: Python Post
item.description: Hello, this post will demonstrate how RStudio allows for python and R to communicate with each other. Letâ€™s load in some libraries. library(reticulate) library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.0 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.2 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.0.3 v dplyr 1.0.2 ## v tidyr 1.1.1 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.3.1 v forcats 0.5.0 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() sns <- import('seaborn') plt <- import('matplotlib.
